newsitem.title: GERMANY: U.S. prepares to evacuate Americans in Albania.
newsitem.headline: U.S. prepares to evacuate Americans in Albania.

text.p: U.S. military commanders stationed in Germany are developing plans to evacuate more than 1,600 Americans living in Albania, a U.S. European Command military spokesman said on Thursday.
U.S. Navy spokesman Bob Anderson said the planning was being done on a "contingency basis". He said no decision has yet been made and no additional troops have been ordered into the Balkan region.

"We are doing standard planning and developing contingency plans. But no troops are being moved around. It is a matter of looking at the situation and making appropriate plans," Anderson told Reuters.

Military officials said any mission by U.S. forces, which they said would likely be "non-combative," to Albania would involve navy and marine forces currently in the Adriatic Sea as part of U.S. forces supporting the Bosnia peacekeeping mission.

Albania, the poorest of the Balkan countries, has been hit by an insurrection that started with protests by tens of thousands of people who lost their savings in high-risk investment funds that collapsed.
President Sali Berisha declared a state of emergency last weekend in response to spreading rioting and anarchy.
Italy and Greece, points of refuge for Albanians in any mass exodus, have both expressed alarm about the unrest rocking the former Stalinist Balkan state, Europe's poorest country.
